description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2kb25","text":"Massively parallel reporter assays test the capacity of putative cis-regulatory elements (CREs) to drive transcription on a genome-wide scale. In nearly all cases, chromatin accessibility is necessary to drive activity, so most CREs are inactive due to chromatin context rather than intrinsic DNA sequence properties. Here, we combined assay for transposase-accessible chromatin (ATAC-seq) with self-transcribing active regulatory region sequencing (STARR-seq) to selectively assay the regulatory potential of nucleosome-free DNA genome-wide. Our approach enabled high-resolution testing of ~50 million unique DNA fragments tiling ~101,000 accessible chromatin regions in human lymphoblastoid cells. To illustrate the application of our approach, we show that 30% of all accessible regions contain an activator, a silencer or both. Benchmarking against standard ATAC-seq, our approach faithfully captures chromatin accessibility and transcription factor (TF) footprints with high signal-to-noise. Integrating three layers of genomic information (accessibility, TF occupancy, and activity) provided by ATAC-STARR-seq, we stratified active and silent CREs by the presence of several TF footprints and show that CREs with specific TF combinations are associated with distinct gene regulatory pathways. Altogether, these data highlight the power of ATAC-STARR-seq to comprehensively investigate the regulatory landscape of the human genome from a single DNA source.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":65,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3dqr0","text":"Dilute oligos to 100 µM in STE buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"62nj1","text":"Make Adaptor Mixes in 200μL PCR tubes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6stbv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bdn2l","text":"Mix (Adaptor A) [50µL]: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eb6t3","text":"    5µL Tn5MERV oligo (100µM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5vs0f","text":"    5µL Tn5_1 Oligo (100µM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"disa8","text":"    40µL H2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ak48q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"29m9e","text":"Mix (Adaptor B) [50µL]: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3h37b","text":"    5µL Tn5MERV oligo (100µM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"10b5i","text":"    5µL Tn5_2_ME_Comp Oligo (100µM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1fhji","text":"    40µL H2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dnudo","text":"Anneal Adaptor solutions separately with thermocycler conditions as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"23uuf","text":"95°C, 3 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cd013","text":"65°C, 3 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8kitu","text":"Ramp to 24°C, -1ºC per cycle, 30 s","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e969h","text":"Hold at 24°C forever","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e5183","text":"After annealing mix: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"em7q1","text":"50µL Adaptor solution A","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6atkd","text":"50µL Adaptor solution B","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9d7ge","text":"100µL Glycerol (≥99.5%)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d338s","text":"200 µL Adaptor mixture, which is now 5 µM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ccs1","text":"Mix the following:
10 µL 5µM Adaptors Mix
10 µL Tn5 (3mg/mL in Tn5 storage buffer)
20 µL Total Reaction Volume
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":42,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cq3sr","text":"Let stand at room temp for 30-60min, then immediately place on ice. Assembled transposome may be stored at -20°C for several months. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7fq1","text":"Turn on all equipment! ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9ru1l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dobmp","text":"Set the microcentrifuge to 4ºC \u0026 the thermomixer to 37ºC. Each of these takes 15-30min to get to their desired temp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1cvjf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"88kup","text":"Count cells in duplicate using a hemocytometer. Record cell count. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2icg4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7kbvq","text":"Note: It is important that cell viability is greater than 85%. If less than 85%, I strongly recommend trying again when viability is much better.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":145}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"82bdk","text":"In two tubes, pellet 200,000 viable cells in each tube at 500 RCF at 4°C for 10 min in a fixed angle centrifuge. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d7rfk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"smdp","text":"Use low-bind Eppendorf tubes to prevent pellets from sticking along the back of the tube (this is much more important for reproducibility than you might think).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":160},{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d3tgu","text":"While waiting, make lysis buffers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e38o0","text":"ATAC-Resuspension Buffer (RSB) containing 0.1% NP40, 0.1% Tween-20, and 0.01% digitonin (lysis buffer):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4m72n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b8mck","text":"For 110μL, mix 1.1μL 10% Tween-20,1.1μL 10% IGEPAL CA-630, 1.1μL 1% digitonin, 106.7μL 1x RSB.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":94}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":44,"length":13}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"9A05A566CEBD11EBBDBD0A58A9FEAC02","url":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8d8e5","text":"ATAC-RSB containing only 0.1% Tween-20 (wash out buffer):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"37a5p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9lahf","text":"For 2.2mL, mix 220μL 10% Tween-20 and 2mL 1x RSB.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":49}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4elds","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cunqo","text":"Keep on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"di5oa","text":"Aspirate supernatant and resuspend each cell pellet in 50µL cold ATAC-Resuspension Buffer (RSB) containing 0.1% IGEPAL CA-630, 0.1% Tween-20, and 0.01% Digitonin and pipette up and down 5 times. In my hands, 50μL for this number of cells works just as well as 200μL and is much more manageable.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":171}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0sgj","text":"Incubate on ice for 3 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":20,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"57d1m","text":"Wash out lysis with 1 ml of cold ATAC-RSB containing ONLY 0.1% Tween-20 and invert tube 3 times to mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"elqo0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"apk2p","text":"Note: The volume used here is a modification to the Omin-ATAC protocol. In my hands, 1mL for this number of cells works just as well as 4mL and is much more manageable.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":168}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3o3am","text":"Immediately pellet nuclei at 500 RCF for 10min at 4°C in a fixed angle centrifuge. While waiting, make transposition mix:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":41,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ddkfd","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"AC7E1980CEC011EB8EE86FE1EEA38599","height":157,"id":191172,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dy3ubdkpx.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f4yebdkpx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dy3vbdkpx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f4ydbdkpx.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14kta","text":"Aspirate all supernatant, carefully avoiding visible cell pellet, using two pipetting steps (aspirate down to 100 ul with a p1000 pipette and remove final 100 ul with a p200 pipette).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3dcd1","text":"Resuspend cell pellets in 180µL of transposition mix by pipetting up and down 10 times. Combine like samples for a total volume of 360μL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9cb4e","text":"Add 40µL assembled Tn5 transposase and quickly vortex to mix well. This is the equivalent to 5μL/reaction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":67,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"410di","text":"Divide resuspension into 8-1.5mL tubes (50μL/tube).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6jv0g","text":"Incubate reaction at 37°C for 30min in a thermomixer with 1000 RPM mixing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"albsu","text":"After incubation, pool the eight like-reactions together in a 15mL conical tube containing 2mL DNA binding Buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7or8i","text":"Purify the small-isolated DNA fragments using the Zymo C+C kit. Run all 2.4mL through one column, adding in 800μL increments. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3g3i","text":"Make PCR mastermix: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cn0gl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9rek","text":"Note: do not use a hot-start polymerase here. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":119}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"771gm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bo6h","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"9DBF1340CEC011EB8EE86FE1EEA38599","height":130,"id":191174,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dy3ybdkpx.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f4ygbdkpx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dy3zbdkpx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f4yfbdkpx.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"foh9v","text":"Run PCR with the following thermocycler parameters:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c3kqb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fdn2t","text":"72 ºC, 5 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"vtia","text":"98ºC, 30 sec","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"901c5","text":"4 cycles of","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"au500","text":"98ºC, 10 sec","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a93vd","text":"62ºC, 30 sec","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"57eqe","text":"72ºC, 1 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fqmhj","text":"Final extension 72ºC, 2 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f5vml","text":"Purify PCR Product using Zymo Clean and Concentrator Kit. Mix 250μL Binding Buffer with 50μL PCR products. Elute in 32µl pre-warmed elution buffer. Incubate on column for 5min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bruf6","text":"Analyze by running 2uL on High-Sensitivity D5000 Tapestation. Determine size distribution and molarity. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8mbo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bc7ct","text":"If it looks good, move on to cloning. Need between 0.04pmols and 0.27pmols total—no more, no less. If there are too many large fragments, perform the SPRI bead size selection below. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"70bk2","text":"*Note: Perform a 0.6X ratio right-side selection to remove fragments larger than 500bp. The volumes listed below are for that ratio specifically. Reference the SPRISelect User Manual if this needs to be altered. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":212}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c4a7v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bg729","text":"Thoroughly shake the SPRIselect bottle to resuspend the SPRI beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5uuol","text":"Add 18μL of SPRIselect to the sample. Pipette up and down and vortex for at least 5 seconds to mix thoroughly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6f1hq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4bad9","text":"Note: Insufficient mixing of sample and SPRIselect will lead to inconsistent size selection results.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":100}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cqrgm","text":"Place the reaction vessel on DynaMag-PCR magnet and allow the SPRI beads to settle to the magnet for ~1min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dsj40","text":"Transfer the clear supernatant, which contains the Right-Side Size Selected sample, to a new reaction vessel. The reaction vessel with the remaining beads can be discarded.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dmqhg","text":"Add 36μL of SPRIselect to the Right-Side Size Selected sample. Pipette up and down and vortex for at least 5 seconds to mix thoroughly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cm25q","text":"Place the reaction vessel on an appropriate magnetic stand or plate and allow the SPRI beads to settle to the magnet for ~1min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8mj3r","text":"Remove and discard the clear supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9jf3d","text":"With the reaction vessel still on the magnet, add 180 μL of freshly-made 85% ethanol and incubate at RT for 30 seconds. Remove and discard ALL of the ethanol supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"brbue","text":"Let the beads dry but not over dry. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6o854","text":"Once cracks are starting to form in the pellet, elute by removing the reaction vessel from the magnet and adding 12μL of 10mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0, elution buffer, or nuclease-free water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6da73","text":"Pipette up and down and vortex for at least 5 seconds to mix thoroughly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"kqkc","text":"Place the reaction vessel on an appropriate magnetic stand or plate and allow the SPRI beads to settle to the magnet for ~1min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6uo0e","text":"Transfer the eluate (size selected sample) to an appropriate storage vessel. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"867b6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7dfce","text":"Note: It is very important to avoid pipetting beads over to the new tube. They can cause the tape station to run inaccurately. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":127}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ckt4u","text":"Analyze size-selected sample by running on 2uL on High-Sensitivity D5000 Tapestation and analyze for concentration and size range. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9abrg","text":"*Note: at this step, you will generate the vector required for the gibson cloning reaction. This linearized vector contains the homology arms for gibson. For this reason, I’ve denoted the reverse primer as N5XX/universal because you can add whatever index you want OR not add an index at all, just like the forward primer. Calculate the reaction molarity as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3fodf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"enjq5","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"36FCCFC0CEC111EB8EE86FE1EEA38599","height":58,"id":191178,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dy38bdkpx.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f4ykbdkpx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dy39bdkpx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f4yjbdkpx.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.section: Clone fragments into linearized hSTARR-Seq_ORI via Gibson Cloning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bu85j","text":"In 4 PCR tubes, combine the volumes of insert and vector as written above. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Clone fragments into linearized hSTARR-Seq_ORI via Gibson Cloning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4abh3","text":"Bring up to a total volume of 5μL with water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"261en","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6uvuk","text":"Note: The total volume cannot exceed 5μL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Clone fragments into linearized hSTARR-Seq_ORI via Gibson Cloning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"42tkh","text":"In a separate PCR tube, preparea negative control where you substitute the inserts for water (only 1 reaction). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Clone fragments into linearized hSTARR-Seq_ORI via Gibson Cloning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"vfo1","text":"Add 5μL of NEBuilder Hifi DNA Assembly 2x MasterMix and mix well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Clone fragments into linearized hSTARR-Seq_ORI via Gibson Cloning
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d5o6q","text":"Incubate at 50°C for 1hr. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"emg74","text":"*This is needed to prevent arching in the Electroporation step. DO NOT SKIP. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"50hc1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7mfm3","text":"Pool all four like-reactions together into a low-bind Eppendorf tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"barr8","text":"Adjust volume to 222.5μL by adding 182.5μL elution buffer (212.5μL to negative control).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1duvd","text":"Add 25μL 3M NaAc pH5.2 and Vortex","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"936o6","text":"Add 2.5μL GlycoBlue and Vortex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"k2l","text":"Add 750μL cold (-20°C) 100% EtOH and vortex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dgl0v","text":"Incubate at -20°C for 30-120min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a50gk","text":"Spin at full speed for 30min @ 4°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"23hbs","text":"Aspirate supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4o20v","text":"Wash with 750μL cold 70% EtOH. Spin at full speed for 15min @ 4°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e7pch","text":"Aspirate supernatant and repeat wash. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dpans","text":"Dry pellet at room temp until dry. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ea5mn","text":"Resuspend pellet in 10μL 10mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0. Pipette up/down until reconstituted. Can stop here, store @ -20°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Electroporation of STARR-seq Plasmid Library into Bacterial Cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cn72t","text":"*In addition to the negative control, do a positive control using the supplied pUC19. For the controls, only do one reaction and use refrozen cells if possible. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fajvk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ep7km","text":"Pre-cool pipette tips, GenePulser cuvettes, and 1.5mL tubes at -20°C. steps.section: Electroporation of STARR-seq Plasmid Library into Bacterial Cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dcspc","text":"Add all 10μL of each gibson sample to a pre-cooled tube (2.5μL for controls). Keep on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Electroporation of STARR-seq Plasmid Library into Bacterial Cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"78m62","text":"Thaw MegaX DH10B cells on ice. Each tube contains ~120μL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":31,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Electroporation of STARR-seq Plasmid Library into Bacterial Cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"17q3n","text":"Add 80μL of thawed cells to each 10μL gibson sample and 20μL to each 2.5μL control using pre-cooled tips. Keep on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Electroporation of STARR-seq Plasmid Library into Bacterial Cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e37qt","text":"Pipette SLOWLY up/down to mix with pre-cooled tips. Then add 20μL (max volume) to a GenePulser 0.1cm cuvette—may need to use 3-4 cuvettes for each sample, but only one for each control. Keep cuvettes on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cposi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9hb82","text":"Note: make sure the volume is touching both metal plates, otherwise it will arc (the best technique here is to pipette into the corner of the cuvette at an angle so the cells reach the bottom). steps.section: Electroporation of STARR-seq Plasmid Library into Bacterial Cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"63c3o","text":"Electroporate with “exponential decay” pulse type at 2kV, 200Ω, and 25μF - (Gap distance is 0.1cm for brown-capped cuvettes). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Electroporation of STARR-seq Plasmid Library into Bacterial Cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"af4ej","text":"Immediately add 1mL pre-warmed SOC media to the 20μL DNA/bacteria mixture in the cuvette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Electroporation of STARR-seq Plasmid Library into Bacterial Cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6m50k","text":"Combine like-reactions into a round bottom 14mL culture tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Electroporation of STARR-seq Plasmid Library into Bacterial Cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ffaiq","text":"Recover at 37°C for 1 hour in shaker incubator. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"i5nf","text":"After recovery make a dilution series: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4sl2v","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"62BA5CD0CEC211EB8EE86FE1EEA38599","height":111,"id":191180,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dy4cbdkpx.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f4ynbdkpx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dy4dbdkpx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f4ymbdkpx.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.section: Low-Read Sequencing of Plasmid Library to Determine Insert Complexity
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e5lvm","text":"Submit samples for paired end sequencing. In the NAR paper, we requested 25M reads at PE150 on NovaSeq. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bif9q","text":"*Each transfection reaction has a max capacity of 5 x106 cells and 10μL DNA. Do 20 reactions to reach 100x106 cells per sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":55,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":108,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fidq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"el66s","text":"*To assess transfection efficiency, conduct an eGFP electroporation and no DNA electroporation (as unstained control). For this, only do one reaction of 5 million cells. The eGFP plasmid is ~2x the size of the ATAC-STARR library plasmids, so to match the required molarity, increase the concentration 2-fold. This control should be done for each individual cell type used in the experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"en9kq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2sa5f","text":"Prepare DNA samples: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bmao9","text":"Add 110μg ATAC-STARR library DNA into a 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube in a max volume of 220μL [This equates to 5μg DNA per 5 million cells].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cfk8f","text":"For GFP control, add 11μg of pcDNA3-eGFP plasmid (endotoxin-free) to a 1.5mL Eppendorf tube in a max volume of 11μL. [This equates to 10μg DNA per million cells]. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6kljh","text":"For no DNA control, add 11μL water to a 1.5mL Eppendorf tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3rjdd","text":"Prepare Suspension Cells: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ciia4","text":"Day 1: Perform cell count (with hemocytometer)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"69l94","text":"Per sample, add 50 mL of warm recovery medium (without antibiotics) into four T-75 culture flasks. Incubate at 37°C until use. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23mhv","text":"For each GFP or noDNA control reaction, add 10mL of media into a T-12.5 culture flasks. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ou9o","text":"Transfer 121 million cells to as many 50 mL falcon tube as necessary and centrifuge at 300xg for 5 minutes. Aspirate supernatant. Wash and resuspend with 45mL of DPBS or PBS, combine pellets. Centrifuge for 300xg for 5 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"194fk","text":"Set up the Neon Pipette Station:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bd955","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9fl30","text":"a. Fill a fresh neon tube with 3 mL of pre-warmed Buffer E2. The electrode on the side of the tube should be     completely submerged in buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dajbs","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5jpj6","text":"b. Insert tube into the pipette station until you hear a click. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2mo7c","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7qsqc","text":"c. Replace neon tube between samples—only need to change between experimental and controls (can use the same     tube for water and GFP if doing water first). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dkrgk","text":"Resuspend cells in 2178μL Buffer R/T. (R for GM12878, GM11831, and SUDHL-6 and T for LCL8664). Gently pipette for a single cell suspension. (Do not leave cells resuspended in Buffer R/T for longer than 15-30 min).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":95,"length":7},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":95,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"as7ha","text":"Electroporation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1fhes","text":"Add 1980μL cells to each ATAC-STARR library DNA and gently mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":52,"length":6},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":52,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8glq3","text":"Add 99μL cells to GFP plasmid. Gently mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":31,"length":6},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":31,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4usea","text":"Add 99μL cells to water. Gently mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":25,"length":6},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":25,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ei6ie","text":"Electroporate 20 ATAC-STARR reactions and both control reactions (100μL at a time) using the following conditions: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7700k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2vthr","text":"100μL Neon Tip, 1100V, 30ms, 2 pulses. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bb1sf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3fuln","text":"If the sample arcs, eject into waste and grab a new tip—19 good reactions are better than 19 good + 1 very dead. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eo4dh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b9ui3","text":"Note: Each tip can be used 5 times. Reuse the tip only if doing an aliquot of the same sample. After use, save the tip and it can be regenerated to use for another application. Regenerated tips are somewhat less efficient and more prone to arcing than fresh tips, so do not use regenerated tips in this protocol. That said, these tips are quite expensive at ~$20 each, so keep that in mind when using. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":311},{"style":"italic","offset":313,"length":89},{"style":"bold","offset":267,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1n3rl","text":"After each electroporation, remove the pipette from the station and expel contents into one of the prepared T-75 (or T-12.5 for control reactions) flasks from step 6 above. Repeat electroporation with remaining aliquots and expel 5 aliquots into each T-75 flask containing 50mL media—cell concentration will be ~500,000 cells/mL. Gently swirl flask after addition of each transfected aliquot. Place in incubator at 37°C for 24 hours. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ust0","text":"***We will use PI as a viability dye; PI will stain dead cells***","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cnlvg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9ktbi","text":"After ~24 hours, for both GFP and No DNA transfections, prepare cells for flow:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"46g8i","text":"Spin down cells in 15mL conical at 300xg, 5min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"chltm","text":"Remove supernatant and resuspend in 5mL 1x PBS or DPBS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5uvbm","text":"Spin at 300xg, 5min. Remove Supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ci5oq","text":"Resuspend in 1000μL Flow Cytometry Buffer (1%BSA in 1xPBS) to achieve a cell density of ~1.25x106 cells/mL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":96,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"sn3u","text":"Split each sample into two aliquots of 500μL each. Pass through the flow cytometry tube cap filter to obtain single-cell suspensions. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bncas","text":"Stain one from each with propidium iodine:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b3itp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2dmtt","text":"Make a 1:1 dilution of 1μg/μL PI solution with 1xPBS+1%BSA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"agg9l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1lrbm","text":"Add 1.25μL of diluted PI to the desired tubes. Vortex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgbpa","text":"Analyze samples with 3-laser or 5-laser Flow Cytometer. Use no DNA as unstained compensation. No DNA+PI and GFP noPI as compensation controls. Analyze viable GFP+PI cells for GFP/no GFP. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
